page.title: 03LANDSCAPE/TRADE
page.content:
on the one side, and by the Village Memorial Hall on the other side.
In front of the Hall is a car-park for about thirty vehicles, and there is a smaller one behind the Hall at the end of a large playing-field. At both ends of the Village there is a small private housing estate.
On the older of the two Council Estates, some tenants have become houseowners whilst others are in process of purchasing from the Council.
{TRADE
The Village is served by a Post Office, five shops, including Butcher's, two Grocer's, Tuck shop and Gift shop. There are three public
